Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Firebase + Google Play Services 71.1620.0 lead to compile error" (#3377) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Update Firebase and Google Play Services from 60.1142.1 to 71.1620.0
2. Build an Android project
3. Observer the error

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior

The project should build.

### Actual Behavior

Build error:

```
4>  obj\Debug\90\android\src\mono\com\google\android\gms\ads\reward\mediation\MediationRewardedVideoAdListenerImplementor.java:4: error: MediationRewardedVideoAdListenerImplementor is not abstract and does not override abstract method zzc(Bundle) in MediationRewardedVideoAdListener
4>  public class MediationRewardedVideoAdListenerImplementor
4>         ^
4>  Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
4>  Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
4>  Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
4>  Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
4>  1 error
4>C:\Operations\Build\Home\Sideroads\Source\Sideroads.Xamarin\Sideroads.Android\obj\Debug\90\android\src\mono\com\google\android\gms\ads\reward\mediation\MediationRewardedVideoAdListenerImplementor.java(4,8): error :  error: MediationRewardedVideoAdListenerImplementor is not abstract and does not override abstract method zzc(Bundle) in MediationRewardedVideoAdListener
4>C:\Operations\Build\Home\Sideroads\Source\Sideroads.Xamarin\Sideroads.Android\obj\Debug\90\android\src\mono\com\google\android\gms\ads\reward\mediation\MediationRewardedVideoAdListenerImplementor.java(4,8): error : public class MediationRewardedVideoAdListenerImplementor
4>C:\Operations\Build\Home\Sideroads\Source\Sideroads.Xamarin\Sideroads.Android\obj\Debug\90\android\src\mono\com\google\android\gms\ads\reward\mediation\MediationRewardedVideoAdListenerImplementor.java(4,8): error : 
```

### Version Information

VS 2019 16.1.6

```
     <PackageReference Include="Xamarin.GooglePlayServices.Ads">
-      <Version>60.1142.1</Version>
+      <Version>71.1712.0</Version>
```

### Log File

<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio:
    a. Click **Tools** > **SDK Command Prompt**.
    b. Within the launched `Terminal.app` window, run:

            adb logcat -d | pbcopy

2. Paste below this comment block
-->

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] fix false warning from r8" (#3374) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/3370
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/3121

In 34ee4735, I introduced an incorrect warning if:

* `android:minSdkVersion` >= 21
* `$(AndroidEnableMultiDex)` is `True`
* `$(AndroidDexTool)` is `d8`

We need to check if any `@(MultiDexMainDexList)` files were present
before issuing the warning. r8 no longer supports custom
`multidex.keep` files in some cases, so this is what the `<R8/>`
MSBuild task is actually meant to warn about.

I also improved the warning message a bit.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""warning XA4306: R8 does not support `MultiDexMainDexList` files" is shown for projects that have no @(MultiDexMainDexList) items set" (#3370) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/commit/34ee4735646d3c6df46bb0b8369c502f0f69d7ca

(I noticed this behavior while looking at the commit to think about what information to include in the draft `d16-3` release notes.)

### Steps to reproduce

 1. Create a new single view Android app project.

 2. Build the project in the Release configuration, with multidex and R8 enabled:

    ```cmd
    msbuild -p:Configuration=Release -p:AndroidEnableMultiDex=true -p:AndroidLinkTool=r8 
    ```

### Expected behavior

A new project that has no `@(MultiDexMainDexList)` items set, and no other changes apart from enabling multidex and R8, should build without any warnings related to multidex or R8.

### Actual behavior

The build produces a warning about multidex and R8:

```
warning XA4306: R8 does not support `MultiDexMainDexList` files when android:minSdkVersion >= 21
```

### Rough first guess at a fix

Maybe it would be OK to move this new warning so that it's guarded by one more condition that checks if `CustomMainDexListFiles` contains any items:

```diff
--- a/src/Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks/Tasks/R8.cs
+++ b/src/Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks/Tasks/R8.cs
@@ -52,7 +52,8 @@ namespace Xamarin.Android.Tasks
 
 			if (EnableMultiDex) {
 				if (MinSdkVersion >= 21) {
-					Log.LogCodedWarning ("XA4306", "R8 does not support `MultiDexMainDexList` files when android:minSdkVersion >= 21");
+					if (CustomMainDexListFiles != null)
+						Log.LogCodedWarning ("XA4306", "R8 does not support `@(MultiDexMainDexList)` files when android:minSdkVersion >= 21");
 				} else if (string.IsNullOrEmpty (MultiDexMainDexListFile)) {
 					Log.LogCodedWarning ("XA4305", $"MultiDex is enabled, but '{nameof (MultiDexMainDexListFile)}' was not specified.");
 				} else {
```

(For this little draft patch, I also added `@()` punctuation around `MultiDexMainDexList` in the warning message to help indicate that it is an MSBuild item name, but either way is fine by me. There's a bit of a mix in the existing warning messages, so I'm not sure which style is preferable.)

While updating this code area, it could possibly also be handy to rename the `R8.MultiDexMainDexListFile` property to something like `R8.MultiDexMainDexListOutputFile` to help distinguish it from the `@(MultiDexMainDexList)` *input* files for anyone who is working on the code in the future. On the other hand, changing the name would change the public API of the `R8` MSBuild task. On top of that, the naming dates back to the older `<CompileToDalvik/>` and `<CreateMultiDexMainDexClassList/>` tasks, so it might only make sense to change it if it's OK to do it for all 3 tasks.

### Version information

Xamarin.Android SDK   9.5.0.27 (d16-3/16c4494)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Remove libzip and LibZipSharp" (#3375) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] fix false warning from r8" (#3374) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/3370
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/3121

In 34ee4735, I introduced an incorrect warning if:

* `android:minSdkVersion` >= 21
* `$(AndroidEnableMultiDex)` is `True`
* `$(AndroidDexTool)` is `d8`

We need to check if any `@(MultiDexMainDexList)` files were present
before issuing the warning. r8 no longer supports custom
`multidex.keep` files in some cases, so this is what the `<R8/>`
MSBuild task is actually meant to warn about.

I also improved the warning message a bit.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "APK build copies sqlite lib for incorrect ABI into APK, causing DllNotFoundException" (#3373) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
We're facing an issue with our projects, when deployed to an x86 emulator and attempting to use SQLite the app fails to load the `libe_sqlite.so` because the ARM version of the library has been packaged by Xamarin Android in the `lib/x86` folder of the APK instead of the correct x86 version.

I have managed to reduce the problem down to a simple repro app, which is attached.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build and deploy the attached repro project in `Debug | x86` configuration to an x86 Android emulator

Reproducing project here:
[bugrepro_nativelibfailure.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/3411233/bugrepro_nativelibfailure.zip)

### Expected Behavior

You should see 'Started OK' in the middle of the activity

### Actual Behavior

Attempting to access the SQLite native library (via a call to Akavache) fails, and the exception is shown in the activity (System.DllNotFoundException: e_sqlite3)

### Investigation Notes

It seems that in the BuildApk task, even though SupportedAbis = x86, the task copies the `armeabi` version of `libe_sqlite.so` into the x86 target directory, leading to the `Apk already contains the item` warnings seen in the deploy logs when it tries to copy the correct x86 version.
It also attempts to incorrectly copy the `x86_64` version onto the same `x86` target file.

Unzipping the APK and checking the included lib confirms that the `lib/x86/libe_sqlite.so` file is indeed the `armeabi` version:

```
unzip com.audiogum.newapp.dev.apk 
file lib/x86/libe_sqlite3.so 
lib/x86/libe_sqlite3.so: ELF 32-bit LSB shared object ARM, EABI5 version 1 (SYSV), dynamically linked, interpreter /system/bin/linker, stripped
```

### Version Information

```

Version 8.1.5 (build 9)
Installation UUID: 6fee0024-dcfc-4914-83ec-91ad57558c5e
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[linker] Make sure we mark *Invoker types" (#3364) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/3263

Looks like
https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/commit/5b945abb2e1f0fe1a9ab6589993c970869c4a752
introduced a new regression, where in some cases we were not marking
the *Invoker type anymore, as [this line](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/commit/5b945abb2e1f0fe1a9ab6589993c970869c4a752#diff-144727b152107ec306fbe284bd5902e3L60)
is gone.

This is fixed by marking the *Invoker types in MarkJavaObjects step.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Link assemblies causes app crashes if you have an EditText in VS2019 Preview 2" (#3263) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add an EditText
2. Choose TextChanged. (Example:  `txtSearch.TextChanged += TxtSearch_TextChanged;`)
3. Choose Linking with either "Sdk Assemblies Only" or "Sdk and User Assemblies".
4. Execute the program.

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior

Be able to execute the TextChanged on Linking with either "Sdk Assemblies Only" or "Sdk and User Assemblies".

### Actual Behavior

App crashes because it cannot load ITextWatcherInvoker.

### Version Information

Windows 10, May Update.
Visual Studio 2019 Preview 2.

### Log File

> System.TypeLoadException: 'Could not load type 'Android.Text.ITextWatcherInvoker' from assembly 'Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'.'

![Annotation 2019-06-20 003519](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1666156/59806029-54449600-92f3-11e9-9df5-b3c453facd90.png)

**P.S.**

It's working in Visual Studio for Mac.

> VS bug [#947890](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/947890)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Enhancement] Footer for Xamarin.Forms TableView" (#6943) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
## Summary
As provided in Xamarin.iOS, it would be nice if there were 'footer' properties exposed with the Xamarin.Forms TableView, both on a grouping level and a table level.

## API Changes

In order to facilitate this change, a Footer property is added to the TableView class, and likewise a Footer or Description property is added to the TableCell class (or whatever the class is). These properties would be strings, since this is easier to bind with and anything else (such as a custom view or image) would almost certainly be better off in a separate view anyway. 

In xaml:

```xml
...
<TableView Intent="Settings">
  <TableSection Title="General">
    <SwitchCell Text="Some advanced setting that merits a short description"
                Footer="Short description".../>
  </TableSection>
  <!-- TableFooter could be a custom section? -->
  <TableFooter Text="Copyright MyCompany Version="{Binding AppVersion}"/>
```
The defaults for these, predictably, would be empty strings.

## Intended Use Case

As suggested in the code example, a use-case for the former would be the ability to provide brief descriptions about a setting or multiple settings. A footer at the table level would be useful for providing any further informative text, or a natural place to put a version number or copyright (I'm guessing most app developers will run into this?).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ListView RefreshControlColor initial" (#5728) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
The initial color of ListView RefreshControlColor on loading first time is not the set color.

### Steps to Reproduce
i set the global color for this ActivityIndicators in App.xaml:

```xml
<Style TargetType="ListView">
    <Setter Property="RefreshControlColor" Value="{StaticResource NavigationPrimary}" />
</Style>

<Style TargetType="ActivityIndicator">
    <Setter Property="Color" Value="{StaticResource NavigationPrimary}" />
</Style>
```

### Expected Behavior
The color should be shown on first loading.

### Actual Behavior
A default color is visible at first loading.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.6.0
- Last known good version: -
- IDE: VS for Mac & Windows
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Tested on iOS: 11.1

### Screenshots

Inital loading:
![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2002916/55146258-80ada380-5144-11e9-808a-373730a921f2.jpg)


Refresh from user (pull to refresh):
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2002916/55146265-830ffd80-5144-11e9-97ac-02dd137f0b32.jpg)

### Reproduction Link

In the forum i [posted](https://forums.xamarin.com/discussion/comment/368887#Comment_368887) a project to reproduce.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Shell.TitleView doesn't appear when specified on the Shell itself." (#6941) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
The [docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/xamarin/xamarin-forms/app-fundamentals/shell/configuration#display-views-in-the-navigation-bar) state regarding `Shell.TitleView` attached property that:
> While this property can be set on a subclassed Shell object, ...

However, when I do exactly that nothing is displayed in the title. Specifying the same title view on a child content page works. Here is a sample code snipped:

```xaml
<Shell xmlns="http://xamarin.com/schemas/2014/forms"
       xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2009/xaml"
       xmlns:views="clr-namespace:ShellTitleViewBug"
       x:Class="ShellTitleViewBug.AppShell">
    <Shell.TitleView>
        <Label Text="Title View Label"
               HorizontalOptions="Center"
               VerticalOptions="Center" />
    </Shell.TitleView>
    <FlyoutItem Title="Flyout Item 1">
        <Tab Title="Tab 1">
            <ShellContent Title="Tab 1 Content">
                <views:Page1/>
            </ShellContent>
        </Tab>
    </FlyoutItem>
</Shell>
```
- IDE: VS 16.1.6
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Android: 9.0 
- Xamarin.Forms 4.0 and 4.1
- Affected Devices: Emulator

Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12996633/61595119-e514d700-abfb-11e9-99e5-b82d6a9c6ac5.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Fix binding an issue with Source and delayed applying values" (#6482) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

When I used `Source` property in `Binding` I had a problem with delaying of applying values. If I use just `Binding` without `Source` a value is applying in `SetInheritedBindingContext` immediately and I can measure a view size exactly after applying a context. But if I use `Source` property of `Binding` in my xaml layout I get a problem. A value is applying after in `BeginInvokeOnMainThread` and it happens after my code tries to measure an element. It's really critical when I work with lists because I want to know a size instantly after applying a context.

I added checking it is invoking in the main thread or not.

Xaml code where I had this problem:
```xaml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ContentView
    x:Class="Xamarin.Forms.Sandbox.TestView"
    xmlns="http://xamarin.com/schemas/2014/forms"
    xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2009/xaml"
    x:Name="This">
    <Label 
        Text="{Binding Source={x:Reference This}, Path=Text}"/>
</ContentView>
```
```csharp
namespace Xamarin.Forms.Sandbox
{
	public partial class TestView : ContentView
	{
		public static readonly BindableProperty TextProperty = BindableProperty.Create(nameof(Text), typeof(string), typeof(TestView));

		public string Text
		{
			get { return (string)GetValue(TextProperty); }
			set { SetValue(TextProperty, value); }
		}

		public TestView()
		{
			InitializeComponent();
		}
	}
}
```

### Issues Resolved ### 

None

### API Changes ###
 
 None

### Platforms Affected ### 

- Core/XAML (all platforms)

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

None

### Before/After Screenshots ### 

Not applicable

### Testing Procedure ###
<!-- Please list the steps that should be taken to properly test these changes on each relevant platform. If you were unable to test these changes yourself on any or all platforms, please let us know. Also, if you are able to attach a video of your test run, you will be our personal hero. -->

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CarouselView View radomly doesnt render items properly on swiping." (#6940) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Firstly want to say a big thanks to finally making CarouselView more real and usable in Xamarin Forms projects although a bug is occuring when swiping between Carousel Items causing some label/views to randonly dissapear or display weirdly. 

### Expected Behavior

Views should be displayed correctly and consisitently

### Actual Behavior

Swiping between carouselview items quickly causing views to misbehave and display unexpectly

- IDE: Visual Studio 2019 Community 16.1.6
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - iOS:  Untested
  - Android: 9.0
  - UWP:  NA

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bottom tab bar moves above when comes back from any page which have Shell.TabBarIsVisible="false"" (#6750) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
I found a annoying issue I have two pages one in which I have bottom tabs and another page with Shell.TabBarIsVisible="false" when I use GoToAsync to navigate to page which have Shell.TabBarIsVisible="false" till now every thing is fine navbar become disable . Problem arise when I go back to page which have bottom tab bar when that page appear tabbar moves upward from it's original place and after a second it's goes back to position when it should be when page appear . I have created a video you can check that 

Video Link :  https://drive.google.com/open?id=19qlZmkQLZKRaGBGDV0rb3q7doZanlxqr
